document_title: Congenital metabolic disorders: Causes, symptoms, treatment
subsection_content:
Congenital metabolic disorder is a recessive genetic disease, so one or both parents carry the recessive gene that causes this disease but are still normal and have absolutely no symptoms of the disease. Therefore, there is no way to prevent the disease. However, the following notes can reduce the possibility of having a child with an inborn error of metabolism:
Do not marry by blood;; Periodic health check-ups and genetic testing before marriage;; Plan your pregnancy and perform prenatal screening at reputable medical facilities;; Perform newborn screening for children when they are first born;; Notify your doctor if you have risk factors for giving birth to a child with a congenital metabolic disorder.
Newborn screening tests will help your baby detect factors and risks of disease early and have early treatment methods
